headline: KFC® Reclaims Sundays with Weekly Digital Deals Designed for Comfort, Not Guilt
summary: Blue Monday may mark the emotional low point of winter, but for many Americans, the pressure often starts the day before. As trends like "Sunday Reset" and "Sunday Scaries" shape how people approach the end of the week, Sunday was once the pause button, now it carries the weight of what's next. With the nationwide launch of "Sundays by KFC," KFC is reclaiming Sundays as a comfort-first ritual, giving fans a reason to look forward to the end of the weekend every Sunday.

headline: Jollibee Plans US Listing for Global Unit by Late 2027
summary: Philippine fast-food group aims to spin off international business to tap deeper US investor demand.

headline: What Yum! Brands (YUM)'s Pizza Hut Review and Upcoming Earnings Reveal About Its Brand Strategy
summary: Earlier this month, Yum! Brands presented at the 2026 ICR Conference in Orlando and is preparing to release its Q4 2025 earnings, with analysts forecasting adjusted EPS of US$1.78 and highlighting its ongoing quarterly dividend of US$0.71 per share. Investor focus has intensified as Yum! Brands undertakes a formal review of options for Pizza Hut, including a potential divestment, potentially reshaping the group’s brand mix and cash-flow profile. We’ll now examine how the Pizza Hut strategic...

headline: Delivery & Carryout Both Rising, Is DPZ Entering a New Balance Phase?
summary: DPZ posts Q3 2025 U.S. sales growth in both delivery and carryout, signaling a rare balance as value promos, loyalty and DoorDash traction lift orders.

headline: Braze Highlights ChatGPT SDK, Agent Console and AI Personalization Push at Needham Conference
summary: Braze (NASDAQ:BRZE) positions itself as a “reference architecture for the modern customer engagement stack,” emphasizing real-time, cross-channel messaging built on stream processing technology, Chief Financial Officer Isabelle Winkles said during a Needham conference discussion with analyst Scott B

headline: Looking At The Narrative For Yum Brands After Pizza Hut Review And Taco Bell Expansion
summary: What Changed in the Yum! Brands Price Target The latest refresh on Yum! Brands trims the fair value estimate only slightly, from about US$165.56 per share to roughly US$164.92, while nudging the discount rate from around 9.09% to about 9.12% and tweaking long term revenue growth assumptions from roughly 7.23% to about 7.25%. This small reset reflects a tug of war between optimism around a tighter focus on Taco Bell and possible Pizza Hut reshaping, and caution around cost pressures, softer...
